oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Unknown photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Speakers Stand at the Blue and Gray Barbeque, Crawfish Springs, GA, September 20, 1889
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: View of speakers stand from ground, crowd facing away from camera.
This joint reunion of Union and Confederate veterans set a precedent that ultimately resulted in the formation of the Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Veterans; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Battlefields
The Persistence of Memory
